publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1730 Trish Godman: Commonwealth Day—That the Parliament, as a new member of the Commonwealth Parliamentary Association and along with all other parliaments and assemblies of the Commonwealth, pays tribute to the Commonwealth on Commonwealth Day, Monday 12 March, and seeks to encourage people of all ages to join together to both increase international understanding and protect democratic institutions where they are under threat so that we can all live in tolerable societies.
S1M-1730 Commonwealth Day (lodged on 7 March 2001) Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Michael Russell*

S1M-1730 Trish Godman: Commonwealth Day—That the Parliament, as a new member of the Commonwealth Parliamentary Association and along with all other parliaments and assemblies of the Commonwealth, pays tribute to the Commonwealth on Commonwealth Day, Monday 12 March, and seeks to encourage people of all ages to join together to both increase international understanding and protect democratic institutions where they are under threat so that we can all live in tolerable societies. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Michael Russell
S1M-1730 Commonwealth Day (lodged on 7 March 2001) Shona Robison*
S1M-1730 Commonwealth Day (lodged on 7 March 2001) Ms Sandra White*
S1M-1730 Commonwealth Day (lodged on 7 March 2001) Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Irene Oldfather*, Robert Brown*
S1M-1730 Commonwealth Day (lodged on 7 March 2001) Mike Watson*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Cathy Peattie*

S1M-1730 Trish Godman: Commonwealth Day—That the Parliament, as a new member of the Commonwealth Parliamentary Association and along with all other parliaments and assemblies of the Commonwealth, pays tribute to the Commonwealth on Commonwealth Day, Monday 12 March, and seeks to encourage people of all ages to join together to both increase international understanding and protect democratic institutions where they are under threat so that we can all live in tolerable societies. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Michael Russell, Shona Robison, Ms Sandra White, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Irene Oldfather, Robert Brown, Mike Watson, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Cathy Peattie
